div.div:
Before submitting request from different sources, requests are wrapped in a object having below properties
dataSourceId : Data Source Identifier
recordSetId // Number of records uploaded in single request/csv
recordId // Identify each record in record set
requestDate // The date of request
The dataSource can be identified
For CSV upload : Provide Separate FTP path to each Client
For SOAP/Rest Request : Using Client Credentials
For Scheduled REST/SOAP Request: Upfront having info as request originated from own system.
Note : This is not any central component , each receiver is responsible for parsing serialised data and wrapping the data with above mentioned properties.

p.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 12px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

div.p: NoSQL Database cluster. Data is indexed on different attributes , so that data can be fetched faster to do reconciliation on different factors .

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 318px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1099px; margin-left: 1131px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 24px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

p.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 12px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

div.p: Database cluster , Sharding is enabled to logically divide data into different partitions to faster load the data.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1125px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1331px; margin-left: 55px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 24px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

u.font: Reconciliation can be done in different ways

p.style: margin: 0px ; font-stretch: normal ; font-size: 12px ; line-height: normal ; font-family: "helvetica neue"

ul.li: Either via log Aggregator , before loading raw data into Request-Topic log each record with following details [ dataSourceId, recordSetId, recordId and requestDate ] . Again while putting data in Processed Data Topic or while consuming using Consumer group log data, The records which are successfully processed.Compare both logs to find where there is mismatch between raw records and successfully processed records.

Reconciliation can also be done from the third party data source , For that records can be fetched for each day , for each dataSource(Partner) speedily using correct indexing while saving data in noSQL DB and comparing with third party data. Either compare total number of records in two systems, or compare some selective attributes of each records or as per requirement compare each and very attribute of the records.

switch.text: Reconciliation can be done in different ways...

a.text: Viewer does not support full SVG 1.1
